title: Who voted for whom in the 2023 Ballon d'Or: The votes of all journalists have been revealed - International
text: In addition to Portugal, eight other countries placed Bernardo Silva among the top 5 footballers in the world last season One of the most anticipated moments has come after the award of a major individual award such as the Ballon d’Or: finding out who voted for whom in the award that distinguishes the best footballer in the world, in this case, from the past sporting season. Without Cristiano Ronaldo in the final list for the first time since 2004, it was up to Manchester City’s Portuguese duo Bernardo Silva and Ruben Dias, who finished 39th in this year’s voting, to represent the national colors at the much-lauded ceremony. It was held on Monday at the Paris (France) exhibition. In the early hours of this Friday, the choices of the 100 journalists who participated in the voting were announced, and we can say that some of the choices are surprising, as is usual in all votes. Specifically in the case of Bernardo Silva, the Portuguese with the best position this year, know that there are 8 other countries, in addition to Portugal – whose responsibility lies with journalist Joaquim Reita (SIC) – that have placed the creative citizen among the top five footballers.
